repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Private Investment and Export
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as marginally
            unsatisfactory. Overall sustainability is assessed as likely
            for those project components rated as satisfactory. Overall
            World Bank performance was satisfactory. Borrower
            performance overall is considered marginally unsatisfactory
            because the deficiencies in the government's
            implementation had such a negative effect on the achievement
            of project objectives. There are three main lessons gleaned
            from this project experience: 1) The Export Development
            Support Program needs exceptionally sound administration
            when provided on a loan basis. 2) Soon after project
            effectiveness, there was a serious financial sector crisis
            and then a recession. In these circumstances, it was
            virtually impossible for the credit line to achieve its goal
            of increasing term intermediation. Although macroeconomic
            instability was clearly discussed in the country analysis
            section of the Staff Appraisal Report, it should have been
            set out in the report's risk section. Mid-term reviews
            in particular should carefully review the influence, past
            and prospective, of the macroeconomic environment on project
            performance. 3) The ability of a credit line to increase
            term lending is problematic. Aside from the fact that
            macroeconomic conditions worsened once again, in retrospect
            it seems evident that domestic financial institutions would
            be reluctant to lend on a long-term basis unless they also
            could obtain funds of a similar tenure.

18218893.theme: Other trade and integration,Trade facilitation and market access,Export development and competitiveness,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization
18218893.majtheme: Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Private Investment and Export
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the project will be to
            help accelerate internationally competitive investments and
            exports of Jamaican private enterprises. The export support
            systems component will establish: (a) an export support
            program to accelerate the acquisition of export know-how in
            export market research, product adaptation, and market
            penetration; (b) a more effective export free trade regime
            mainly through a privately controlled free trade zone (FTZ)
            regime, privatization of existing FTZs, and a single factory
            free zone regime to extend equal footing status to
            enterprises in the Customs Territory; and (c) a labor
            training and adjustment program to facilitate skill
            upgrading and labor redeployment as required by new
            enterprise investments. The financial sector support
            component will enhance the basis for capital markets
            development and financial intermediation through: (a) a
            financial sector advisory program aimed to help upgrade
            prudential regulations and banking supervision, reshape the
            operations of the Government's two public development
            banks, and increase export financing through training and a
            preshipment guarantee program; and (b) a long-term credit
            program to finance investments expected to build or
            restructure, largely export-oriented, production capacity.
